intro: Chamaesyce pileoides, commonly known as the woollyleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, exhibiting a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are covered in dense, white, woolly hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences, and the plant is often found in disturbed or arid environments.
